summary: This is a pack of custom made Sunglare textures that were made to make Skyrim look more cinematic  while maintaining a clean landscape
descriptionHtml:
[b][u][center][/center][/u][/b][center][b]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/oKIWwdq.png[/img][/b]
[b]

[size=4]"Thank you for supporting this mod and helping me with suggestions. This mod has gotten 100+ endorsements and 2500+ downloads. Although this number is constantly raising, the numbers don't matter. The thing that matters is that the work is top quality, which is what the numbers actually represent. I know that you are getting what you want out of the mod if you endorse and comment what you think. Thank you for everything and thanks for the positive feedback" -GWP14[/size][/b][/center][center][b][u]
[/u][/b][/center][center][b][u]_______________________________________________________________________________[/u][/b][/center][center]
[b][size=5]-WHAT-[/size][/b]

[size=3]There were no sunglares on the nexus that gives the game a nice cinematic anamorphic lens flare, so I had to change that. Then I decided to make a pack too, to give people more options. this does NOT require an ENB to use it, but it CAN be used with an ENB for a greater effect.[/size]
    
[b][size=5]-UPCOMING UPDATES-[/size][/b]
   [size=3]
-1.5.5 Vertical Sunglares            [/size][size=3]
[/size] 
[b][size=5]-HOW TO INSTALL-[/size][/b]

[b][font=Times New Roman][size=4][i]If you want your sun to be brighter, and you have an ENB, click Shift+Enter, and extend the "Sky" part of the menu. scroll down to "sun corona intensity", and up that amount to what you prefer. You can also do this in your "enbseries" file. again, just scroll down to sky and edit the "sun corona intensity".  (I prefer it to be set to 2.00, because I love lens flares)

[/i][/size][/font][/b]Here what the enbseries.ini should look like

[SKY]

Enable=true
|
|
\/
scroll down to:

SunCoronaIntensity=2.0 <--change the value to 2.00 - 3.00 depending on how intense you want it      
SunCoronaCurve=0.1 <-- keep as is                                                                                                  
SunCoronaDesaturation=0.0 <--change to 0.00, so you will get the most color out out of the sunglares
[size=3]
Option A: there is only 1 option, so you can just place the data folder into your Skyrim directory.
[/size][size=3]
Option B, C, D, and E: there are other options for the specific lens flare, so you will have to decide which one you want, and then place the data folder of your chosen flare into your Skyrim directory[/size]

[size=3]If you are using NMM, I only have option A able to be downloaded through the mod manager. The other ones that are available will have to be downloaded manually until I make it so you can choose what sunglare you want in the NMM menu. [/size]

[b][size=5]-HOW TO UNINSTALL-[/size][/b]

[size=3]You can go in Skyrim\Data\textures\sky\ and delete the sunglare texture. This mod does NOT edit the sun texture.[/size]
[size=3]For uninstalling Climates of Tamriel, you have to go to Skyrim\Data\textures\sky\climatesoftamriel and delete THAT sunglare instead[/size]

[b][size=5]-COMPATIBILITY-[/size][/b]

[size=3]Compatible with Climates of Tamriel[/size]
[size=3]NOT compatible with any mod that changes the sunglare texture, but it IS Compatible with mods that change only the sun (corona) texture[/size]

[b][size=5]-CHANGE LOG-
[/size][/b]      [/center][center][size=3]-1.0 Added CoT support and made options A, B, and C                        [/size]
[size=3]-1.1 Made Option B lens flare extended brighter                                 [/size]
[size=3]-1.2 Changed back to lighter colored Option B Sunglares                     [/size]
[size=3]-1.3 Added HD Sunglare Option D                                                        [/size]
[size=3]-1.3.5 Fixed morphed Hexagons by making circles instead for Option D[/size]
[size=3]-1.3.6 Fixed left over paintbrush strokes left on the Option D Texture [/size]
[size=3]-1.3.7 All textures will be changed to 2k textures                               [/size]
[size=3]-1.3.8 fixed missing files and added Option D x512 version                  
-1.3.9 Fixed the non-aligned Option A sunglare                                   
-1.4  Added Option D Red                                                                   
-1.5 Dying Light Styled Sunglares                                                        [/size]

[b][size=5]-CREDITS-[/size][/b]

[size=3]Over- for the text in the pictures[/size]
[size=3]Bethesda- for this excellent game[/size]
[size=3]Procreate- for resizing files, changing file type, and helped make these flares[/size]
[size=3]Nexusmods- for being an amazing modding site[/size]
[size=3]Photoshop- for letting me edit the lens flare to make them better[/size][/center]
author: GWP14
